content.description:
This looks to be the old bomb route from the guide book. It now has glues-in to the top anchors. Start beside a pine tree and underneath a Roof.  Make a move that requires effort.  Be mindful for some loose rock, it has been cleaning up more in the past year.

Old death blocks have been removed.
content.location: Left of Black Rain, starts by pine tree

climbs.name: My Husband is Going to Kill Me (aka. Start the Car)

content.description: The route pretty much follows a straight line from the ground to the pine tree at the top.
content.protection: Bolted anchors are located 2 feet below the top of the cliff next to the pine tree.  They are really easy to miss if you don't know exactly where to look, so keep your eyes open for the tree. You have to get right up on the edge and look over to see the bolts.  Long webbing required to use the bolted anchors.  Many get lazy and anchor from the tree, which is highly discouraged.
content.location: Start in the middle of the wall under a tall pine tree (60 feet up). Route is to the left of the popular "black rain" sport route.

content.description: This route can be anywhere from a 5.8 to a 5.12, depending on where you climb in relation to the bolts. If you climb generally straight up through the bolt line it's a 5.9. You can dodge the crux by heading right to a flake (5.8) and still reach the bolt. Climbing to the left of the bolts is considerably harder.
content.location: On the wall to the right of the Amphitheater. Look for a bolt line toward the right end of the face.
